page.title: 01General Survey,Ashey
page.content: Most of the area is covered by {farmland.}Very few people live there. The nearest town is Ryde. There are no major{roads}and the railway line is closed although most of the route is still visible. The island is a tourist centre and the Council has just completed a new {trail}called the Downs Way which passes through the area. There is some woodland and in the South are the downs from which there are magnificent views of the Arreton valley further South. There are two{streams}draining the area. Both run Northwards.One joins the sea at Wootton and the other at Ryde. {Nunwell House,}until recently the home of the Oglander family,is the largest building in the area.
